Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that lava has shot out of one of the geysers in Yellowstone National Park for the first time in recorded human history.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the reported event of lava shooting out of geysers in Yellowstone National Park did not occur.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is not reported by any legitimate news outlet.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the string of earthquakes in Montana and Wyoming caused the lava to come gushing out of geysers at Yellowstone National Park, which is not supported by evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the image accompanying the claim is not related to Yellowstone National Park but is a screen grab from a video showing lava entering the ocean in Hawaii.
